name: bioinformatics/bedtools/merge
title: Combines overlapping or book-ended features in an interval file into a single feature which spans all of the combined features, using the bedtools merge function.

s.title: Force strandedness by only merging features on the same strand.
s.description: Only merge intervals that are overlapping/book-ended AND are on the same strand. This is disabled, by default.

S.title: Force merge for one specific strand only.
S.description: Follow with + or - to force merge from only the forward or reverse strand, respectively. By default, merging is done without respect to strand.

d.title: Maximum distance between features allowed for features to be merged.
d.description: The maximum distance between features allowed for features to be merged. The default is 0, meaning only overlapping and/or book-ended features are merged.

c.title: Specify columns from the input file to operate upon
c.description: Specify columns from the input file to operate upon. Requires use of 'o' operator to specify the operation that should be applied. Multiple columns can be specified in a comma-delimited list.

o.title: Specify the operation that should be applied to -c.
o.description: If there is only column, but multiple operations, all operations will be applied on that column. If there is only one operation but mutliple columns, that operation will be applied to all columns. Otherwise, the number of columns must match the the number of operations, and will be applied in respective order.

header.title: Print the header from the A file prior to results.

delim.title: Specify a custom delimiter for the -nms and -scores concat options.
